title: Jørgen Grotdal
content:
Trying once again.  
I found this script font again in several of his works, and it bothers me, that I can't figure out which font it is.  
It's not "That's a font", and I know, that it's not a handmade font.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701140112im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Sk%C3%A6rmbillede%202014-06-24%20kl_5999.%2015.23.11.png)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Skærmbillede 2014-06-24 kl. 15.23.11.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701140112/http:/typophile.com/files/Sk%C3%A6rmbillede%202014-06-24%20kl.%2015.23.11.png) | 294.15 KB |
author: saeglopur

comments.content: What's wrong with the idea it could be a personal font like he did with [Quaint](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701140112/http:/typophile.com/wiki/https%3A/%252Fwww.behance.net/gallery/Quaint/15535095)? Try asking him, he may answer...

Well, most of is illustrations are just clip-art, so I figured this wasn't his own font.

Isn't Quaint made by James Lewis, by the way? Or am I missing something?

> Well, most of is illustrations are just clip-art, so I figured this wasn't his own font.

Don't yell it too loudly, some could be shocked ;) Kidding :) But you may be right. Thing is you posted this one twice and nobody identified it. Even Fivos' fantastic software ' [Find my Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701140112/http:/www.findmyfont.com/)' was defeated.

> Isn't Quaint made by James Lewis, by the way? Or am I missing something?

Jørgen Grotdal and James Lewis are both credited on this font (check 'owners', top of the [page](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701140112/http:/www.behance.net/gallery/Quaint/15535095)). Both work for 'The Ligature Collective'.
Alright. Thanks for trying - you're always doing an amazing job.
